security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing NixOS configuration patterns. No executable code, network calls, or file operations are present. The skill provides static examples of NixOS and home-manager module configurations.

content.user_title: Configure NixOS Systems with Proven Patterns
content.value_statement: Setting up NixOS modules can be complex with scattered documentation. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for common NixOS and home-manager configurations.
limitations: Does not include advanced NixOS features
Limited to home-manager and NixOS configurations

use_cases.title: Standardize NixOS Configurations
use_cases.description: Use proven patterns to maintain consistent NixOS systems across development, staging, and production environments.

use_cases.title: Deploy Home Environments
use_cases.description: Configure user environments with home-manager using tested module patterns for dotfiles and packages.

use_cases.title: Manage System Services
use_cases.description: Implement NixOS modules for system-wide services and configurations with best practice patterns.

best_practices: Use descriptive module names that indicate their purpose
Test configurations in a VM before deploying to production
anti_patterns: Avoid putting all configurations in a single large file
Do not hardcode system-specific paths or usernames
Never skip testing configurations after major NixOS updates

faq.question: Is this compatible with all NixOS versions?
faq.answer: The patterns use standard NixOS/home-manager syntax that works with recent stable versions.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with flakes?
faq.answer: Yes, the module patterns work with both traditional and flake-based NixOS configurations.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing configurations?
faq.answer: Import the modules in your home/default.nix or configuration.nix file as shown in the examples.

faq.question: Are these patterns safe for production use?
faq.answer: These are standard configuration patterns used in many production NixOS deployments.

faq.question: What if my package is not in nixpkgs?
faq.answer: You can create custom packages or use overlays, though those patterns are not covered here.

faq.question: Can I share my configurations between machines?
faq.answer: Yes, modular configurations make it easy to share common settings across multiple systems.
